qas.question: What period saw a large upswing in Evangelicalism?
Methodism is part of what movement?
Where did the Great Awakenings increase interest in Evangelicalism?
What man is associated with the beginnings of Evangelicalism?

context: It gained great momentum in <a0_0>the 18th and 19th centuries<a0_0/> with the emergence of Methodism and the Great Awakenings in <a2_0>Britain and North America<a2_0/>. The origins of <a1_0>Evangelicalism<a1_0/> are usually traced back to the English Methodist movement, <a3_0>Nicolaus Zinzendorf<a3_0/>, the Moravian Church, Lutheran pietism, Presbyterianism and Puritanism. Among leaders and major figures of the Evangelical Protestant movement were John Wesley, George Whitefield, Jonathan Edwards, Billy Graham, Harold John Ockenga, John Stott and Martyn Lloyd-Jones.
